result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:07 PM Defendant Albert A Bandoian in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Griffis states Attorney Daniel Murry has been court appointed in the defendants other matter who is willing to take on this new case if the Court is willing to extend the appointment.  Defendant sworn and testified as to his current financial circumstances.  The Court will extend the appointment of Attorney Daniel Murray from case 21CF656 to this case.  The State has no objection to the Court tolling the time limits until the defendants next date before the Trial Court.  Court sets a status of counsel date before Judge Melvin with case 21CF656.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing and if matter needs to be set for a preliminary hearing, it may be set back before Commissioner Court.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
